means: 用拳猛击( punch的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: They just rolled about on the floor punching each other like schoolboys.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们像小学生一样，在地板上滚来滚去，互相挥着拳头揍对方。

sentence.Network_en: I will have no one punching anyone else up in my hotel.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我的旅馆里我不让任何人动手同别人打架.

sentence.Network_en: In the past, many kids would settle disputes by punching each other out.
sentence.Network_cn: 过去，很多孩子用拳头解决矛盾。

entry.def: If you punch someone or something, you hit them hard with your fist.

example.ex: After punching him on the chin she wound up hitting him over the head...
example.tran: 她先挥拳打他的下巴，然后又打他的脑袋。

example.ex: He punched the wall angrily, then spun round to face her.
example.tran: 他生气地用拳捶墙，接着转过身来面对着她。

entry.def: If you punch the air, you put one or both of your fists forcefully above your shoulders as a gesture of delight or victory.

example.ex: At the end, Graf punched the air in delight, a huge grin on her face.
example.tran: 最后，格拉夫高兴得挥动着拳头，脸上笑开了花。

entry.def: If you punch something such as the buttons on a keyboard, you touch them in order to store information on a machine such as a computer or to give the machine a command to do something.

example.ex: Mrs. Baylor strode to the elevator and punched the button.
example.tran: 贝勒太太迈向电梯，按下按钮。

entry.def: If you punch holes in something, you make holes in it by pushing or pressing it with something sharp.

example.ex: I took a ballpoint pen and punched a hole in the carton.
example.tran: 我拿了一支圆珠笔，在纸盒上戳了一个洞。

entry.def: A punch is a tool that you use for making holes in something.

example.ex: Make two holes with a hole punch.

entry.def: If you say that something has punch, you mean that it has force or effectiveness.

example.ex: My nervousness made me deliver the vital points of my address without sufficient punch...
example.tran: 我太紧张，没能有效地传达我演说的要点。

example.ex: Hurricane Andrew may be slowly losing its punch, but its winds are still around 100 miles an hour.
example.tran: 飓风安德鲁的风力可能会逐渐减弱，但风速仍在每小时100英里左右。

entry.tran: 潘趣酒，宾治酒（各种酒和糖、柠檬、调料等勾兑而成的饮料）
entry.def: Punch is a drink made from wine or spirits mixed with things such as sugar, lemons, and spices.
If you say that someone does not pull their punches when they are criticizing a person or thing, you mean that they say exactly what they think, even though this might upset or offend people.

example.ex: She has a reputation for getting at the guts of a subject and never pulling her punches.
example.tran: 她论事一针见血是出了名的，从来都是直言不讳。

auth_sentence.content: Fans will be gleefully punching the air within minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Fans will be gleefully punching the air within minutes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Fans will be gleefully punching the air within minutes.

auth_sentence.res_content: That's when they get angry and start punching.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That's when they get angry and start punching.

auth_sentence.content: "No-one is punching the air," he admitted.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "No-one is punching the air," he admitted.
